definition: to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Wan brothers film animation news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 万氏兄弟拍摄动画影片的消息，不胫而走。

sentences.english: The news was passed on by word of mouth.
sentences.chinese: 众口相传，消息不胫而走。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, news of what she has done has spread far beyond Riceville.
sentences.chinese: 事的消息不胫而走，远远地传出了赖斯维尔镇以外。

sentences.english: News is flying about concerning a royal wedding.
sentences.chinese: 有关皇室婚礼的消息不胫而走。

sentences.english: News travels fast, especially juicy news.
sentences.chinese: 消息会不胫而走，特别是八卦新闻。

sentences.english: Thereupon, the view which falls ill about the LiHunan disappears without a trace.
sentences.chinese: 于是，关于李湘生病的说法不胫而走。

sentences.english: The news swept through the firm.
sentences.chinese: 这消息在公司中不胫而走。

sentences.english: This idea spread like wildfire, the team reached the branch secretary in the spring of your ears.
sentences.chinese: 这想法不胫而走，传到该队党支部书记于春贵耳朵里。

definition: news pass quickly from mouth to mouth (idiom)/an infectious disease spreads quickly (old meaning)
pinyin: yi1 chuan2 shi2 , shi2 chuan2 bai3

definition: widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
